tests.name: Check required HTML files exist
tests.run: ls index.html login.html registration.html cse.html ece.html eee.html civil.html cart.html

tests.name: index.html has header, nav, and table
tests.run: grep -i '<header' index.html && grep -i '<nav' index.html && grep -i '<table' index.html

tests.name: catalogue pages have book table
tests.run: grep -i '<table' cse.html && grep -i '<table' ece.html && grep -i '<table' eee.html && grep -i '<table' civil.html

tests.name: login.html has form with input fields
registration.html has text/email/password/tel/date fields
tests.run: grep -i 'type="text"' registration.html && grep -i 'type="email"' registration.html && grep -i 'type="password"' registration.html && grep -i 'type="tel"' registration.html && grep -i 'type="date"' registration.html

tests.name: cse.html has at least 10 articles
tests.run: if [ $(grep -ic '<article' cse.html) -ge 10 ]; then echo '10 or more'; fi

tests.name: ece.html has at least 5 articles
tests.run: if [ $(grep -ic '<article' ece.html) -ge 5 ]; then echo '5 or more'; fi

tests.name: eee.html has at least 5 articles
tests.run: if [ $(grep -ic '<article' eee.html) -ge 5 ]; then echo '5 or more'; fi

tests.name: civil.html has at least 5 articles
tests.run: if [ $(grep -ic '<article' civil.html) -ge 5 ]; then echo '5 or more'; fi
